channel.description: Recent content in Blogs on Project Portfolio

item.title: Using Python in R Part 2!
item.description: Let’s find the volume of earth! library(reticulate) ## Warning: package 'reticulate' was built under R version 3.6.3 We know the radius of earth is approximately 6,378 miles long. #Python r=6378 We also know that the earth is (roughly) spherical in shape! #R 4*pi*(((py$r)^3)/3) ## [1] 1.086781e+12 v<-4*pi*(((py$r)^3)/3) We have found that earth’s volume is a really, really big number! It comes out to approximately 1086781000000 cubic miles! Want to convert that to cubic kilometers?

item.title: Using Python in R Studio
item.description: Want to know what Spongebob and Patrick are laughing about? Let me tell you using R and Python! library(reticulate) ## Warning: package 'reticulate' was built under R version 3.6.3 Python: s="Hey Patrick, I thought of something funnier than 24" R: print(py$s) ## [1] "Hey Patrick, I thought of something funnier than 24" z<-"Let me hear it" Python: r.z ## 'Let me hear it' y=24 R: py$y+1 ## [1] 25 l<-"lololol" Python:
